label.en: 24/25 S regular part 2 5 CP MV Eng
label.et: 24/25 K PÕ 2. osa 5 EAP MV Eng

description.en:
The course of "Biology" (10.0 ECTS) gives students an understanding, basic knowledge and skills in modern biology.
Lectures have following topics: modern cell biology and molecular biology, biology of development, genetics, theory of evolution and human ecology (including medical parasitology).
Practicals have following topics: modern cell biology and biology of development, genetics and cytogenetics, human ecology (medical parasitology).
description.et:
Antud õppeaine (10,0 EAP) loengukursus annab ülevaate kaasaegse bioloogia põhilistest valdkondadest: raku-, molekulaar-, arengubioloogiast, geneetikast, evolutsiooniteooriast ja inimese ökoloogiast (s.h meditsiinilisest parasitoloogiast). 
Praktikumides leiavad käsitlemist raku- ja arengubioloogia, geneetika ja inimese ökoloogia (meditsiinilise parasitoloogia) küsimused.

objectives.en: The aim of the  subject is to give students of first year an overview in modern biology. The course is focused on molecular biology and genetics and has medical and applied orientation. The topic of the medical parasitology is integrated into the course.
objectives.et:
Õppeaine eesmärgiks on meditsiiniteaduste valdkonna arstiteaduse I kursuse üliõpilastele ülevaate andmine tänapäeva bioloogia põhilistest valdkondadest. 
Kursus on molekulaarbioloogia- ja geneetikakeskne ja samas meditsiinilis-rakendusliku suunitlusega. Kursusesse  on integreeritud meditsiinilise parasitoloogia osa.

learning_outcomes.en:
As a result of successful passing this course the student knows the basic concepts of all main branches of modern human biology, their applications in medicine, and is able to use this knowledge for understanding and solving practical problems.

After passing the cell biology and molecular biology the student:
1)	Comprehends nature and mechanisms of replication, transcription and translation and their relations with central functions of a eukaryotic cell
2)	Comprehends structure and function of eukaryotic cell organelles and understands their relations with pathological processes
3)	Comprehends major methods in molecular and cell biology and their usage in medicine

After passing the genetics the student:
1)	Knows hierarchical system of material bases of inheritance and functional processes of heredity. Possesses principles of genetics and is able to use these in practice
2)	Knows main types of human hereditary diseases, principles of their classification and frequencies in populations
3)	Knows methods in human genetics
4)	Knows principles of population genetics, its basic law and is able to use these in practice

After passing the developmental biology the student:
1)	Knows mechanisms of mitosis, meiosis, oogenesis and spermatogenesis and their correlations with human pathological processes
2)	Knows processes and mechanisms typical for different periods of ontogenesis
3)	Is able to connect theoretical knowledge with morphological structures in normal development and in pathology

After passing the human ecology and evolutionary biology the student:
1)	Knows morphology, life cycles and distribution routes of parasites; pathogenesis, symptoms, diagnosis, prophylaxis and main schedules of treatment of parasitic diseases
2)	Knows principles of environmental protection and medical problems related with pollution of environment
3)	Knows types of evolutionary theories; levels, factors and regularities of synthetic evolutionary theory. Has knowledge of human evolution
learning_outcomes.et:
Pärast kursust teab üliõpilane kaasaegse inimesebioloogia põhivaldkondade teoreetilisi aluseid ja oskab teadmisi rakendada praktilises tegevuses probleemsituatsioonide mõistmisel ja lahendamisel.

Molekulaar- ja rakubioloogia:
1) Teab matriitssünteeside (replikatsioon, transkriptsioon, translatsioon) olemust, nende rolli raku funktsioonide tagamisel.
2) Teab eukarüootse raku ja selle organellide ehitust ja talitlust, seoseid patoloogiliste protsessidega. 3) Teab tähtsamaid molekulaar- ja rakubioloogilisi uurimismeetodeid, nende kasutust diagnostilistes lähenemistes.

Geneetika:
1) Teab pärilikkuse materiaalsete aluste hierarhilise süsteemi ehitust, talitlust ja pärilikkuse funktsionaalseid protsesse. 
2) Valdab pärandumise seaduspärasusi ja oskab neid rakendada praktikas.
3) Teab pärilikust muutlikkusest tingitud inimese haiguste põhitüüpe, nende aluseid ja sagedusi. 
4) Teab inimese geneetikas kasutatavaid meetodeid. 
5) Teab populatsioonigeneetika aluseid, seaduspärasusi ja oskab neid kasutada praktikas.

Arengubioloogia:
1) Teab meioosi, mitoosi, oogeneesi ja spermatogeneesi mehhanisme ja seoseid patoloogiaga.
2) Omab teadmisi ontogeneesi etappidel asetleidvate protsesside kohta.
3) Oskab teadmisi seostada arengu morfoloogiliste struktuuridega nii normis kui patoloogias. 

Inimese ökoloogia ja evolutsiooniline bioloogia:
1) Ökoloogia, teema meditsiiniline parasitoloogia: teab parasiitide ehitust, elutsükleid ja levikuteid; parasiitnakkuste patogeneesi, sümptomeid, diagnoosimeetodeid, raviskeeme, profülaktikat.
2) Ökoloogia, teema keskkond: teab keskkonnakaitse aluseid ja saastamisega kaasnevaid meditsiinilisi probleeme.
3) Omab ettekujutust bioevolutsioonist. Teab: evolutsiooniteooriate tüübid, sünteetilise evolutsiooniteooria tasemed, tegurid ja seaduspärasused. Omab ettekujutust inimese põlvnemisest.

Positiivse hinde saamiseks tuleb materjali vallata kõikides teemades vähemasti teadmiste tasemel Bloomi taksonoomia järgi (1956).

description.en:
WRITTEN TEST-1 (pKT1) covers themes passed in parasitology: medically important pathogenic and opportunistic protozoa.
test

grade_preconditions.en:
Participation in all seminars and practical classes.
Passing both parasitology tests and the slide test with a positive result.
grade_preconditions.et:
Participation in all seminars and practical classes. 
Passing both parasitology tests and the slide test with a positive result.

A.en: Grade 'A': the student obtained a score between 91% and 100% of the maximum points. The student has an excellent level of knowledge in biology. 91-100% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.
A.et: Grade 'A': the student obtained a score between 91% and 100% of the maximum points. The student has an excellent level of knowledge in biology. 91-100% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.

B.en: Grade 'B': the student obtained a score of 81-90% of the maximum points. The student has a very good level of knowledge in biology. 81-90% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.
B.et: Grade 'B': the student obtained a score of 81-90% of the maximum points. The student has a very good level of knowledge in biology. 81-90% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.

C.en: Grade 'C': the student obtained 71-80% of the maximum points. The student has a good level of knowledge in biology. 71-80% of the syllabus has been acquired.
C.et: Grade 'C': the student obtained 71-80% of the maximum points. The student has a good level of knowledge in biology. 71-80% of the syllabus has been acquired.

D.en: Grade 'D': the student obtained 61-70% of the maximum points. The student has a satisfactory level of knowledge in biology. 61-70% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.
D.et: Grade 'D': the student obtained 61-70% of the maximum points. The student has a satisfactory level of knowledge in biology. 61-70% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.

E.en: Grade 'E': the student obtained a score of 51-60% of the maximum points. The student has a minimum level of knowledge in biology. 51-60% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.
E.et: Grade 'E': the student obtained a score of 51-60% of the maximum points. The student has a minimum level of knowledge in biology. 51-60% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.

F.en: Grade 'F': the student did not meet the conditions for passing the examination or the student scored 50% or less of the maximum points. The student does not have the minimum level of knowledge in biology. 0-50% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.
F.et: Grade 'F': the student did not meet the conditions for passing the examination or the student scored 50% or less of the maximum points. The student does not have the minimum level of knowledge in biology. 0-50% of the content of the syllabus has been acquired.

description.en:
